title: Sub-RBS (Hard Version)
description:
This is the hard version of the problem. The difference between the versions is that in this version, you need to find the sum of scores over all subsequences of ğ‘ ; ğ‘  is not necessarily a regular bracket sequence, and the constraints on ğ‘› are lower.

In other words, the score of ğ‘¡ is the length of the longest regular bracket subsequence of ğ‘¡ which is better than ğ‘¡. If ğ‘¡ is not a regular bracket sequence, or if no regular subsequence better than ğ‘¡ exists, the score is 0.

You are given a bracket sequence ğ‘  of length ğ‘›. Find the sum of the scores of all non-empty subsequences of ğ‘  modulo 998244353.

A sequence ğ‘ is a subsequence of a sequence ğ‘ if ğ‘ can be obtained from ğ‘ by the deletion of several (possibly, zero or all) element from arbitrary positions.
